summary: Email correspondence between journalist Daniel Bates and an unnamed US Attorney's Office representative regarding Prince Andrew's claims that he had not been approached by US authorities, contradicting statements from US Attorney Geoffrey Berman. The representative corrects Bates's reference to Berman's title and declines to comment on the story.

persons.name: Daniel Bates
persons.context: Journalist in New York who is inquiring about Prince Andrew's claims and the contradiction with Geoffrey Berman's statements for a Daily Mail story.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: US Attorney whose statements about approaching Prince Andrew are contradicted by Andrew's claims, as noted in the journalist's inquiry.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.context: Prince Andrew, who is claiming he has not been approached by US authorities, contradicting what Geoffrey Berman said.

persons.name: Lewis Pennock
persons.context: Person who forwarded an email with a PDF attachment to Daniel Bates, as part of the email chain.

connections.description: Journalist seeking comment from the US Attorney's Office regarding statements made by Berman about Prince Andrew.
Berman, as US Attorney, is involved in the investigation regarding Prince Andrew, with Andrew claiming he hasn't been approached despite Berman's statements.
Journalist reporting on Prince Andrew's claims regarding not being approached by US authorities.

events.title: Daily Mail story inquiry about Prince Andrew
events.description: Journalist Daniel Bates contacts the US Attorney's Office for comment on a story about Prince Andrew claiming he hasn't been approached by US authorities, contradicting Geoffrey Berman's statements.

keyFacts: Prince Andrew claimed he had not been approached by US authorities, contradicting statements from US Attorney Geoffrey Berman.
Journalist Daniel Bates sought comment from the US Attorney's Office for a Daily Mail story on this contradiction.
The US Attorney's Office representative corrected Bates's reference to Geoffrey Berman as 'State Attorney for New York' to 'United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York'.
The US Attorney's Office declined to comment on the story regarding Prince Andrew's claims.
